page.title: 02A SCHOOL HEADMASTER
page.content: It was whilst reading through one of the school log books that I realised that although the log book gives information of the daily happenings it doesn't give an insight into the teachers as people.One entry in an early log book states that the head teacher died after 46 years in the school. As to what kind of person he was there is no indication. My name is Richard Murphy and am 52 years of age.Born in Belfast I joined the R.A.F.in 1950 and served as a radio technician working on a variety of aircraft. Vulcan, Victor,Javelin. I entered teacher's training college in 1967 and qualified in 1970. I was appointed head of this school in Jan.1982. I enjoy my work very much. There are no discipline problems with the children who appear to enjoy the work we do in school.No one gets caned
